definitions.title: Definition
definitions.description: A node is simply a container for a value, plus a pointer to a "next" node (which may be null).

definitions.title: Node
list: Constructor( Element value, Node nextNode ): Create a new node, with value as its contained value and next as the value of the next pointer
Node getNext(): Returns the value of node's next pointer
Element getValue(): Returns the value contained in node n
setValue( Element value ): Sets the contained value to be value
setNext( Node nextNode ): Sets the value of node's next pointer to be nextNode

definitions.title: Chain
list: put( Node node ): put a node to this chain
Node getFirstNode(): get the first node of this chain
removeNode( Node node ): remove the node if exist

definitions.title: Asymptonic Notation
definitions.description: A problem may have numerous algorithmic solutions. In order to choose the best algorithm for a particular task, you need to be able to judge how long a particular solution will take to run. Or, more accurately, you need to be able to judge how long two solutions will take to run, and choose the better of the two.
